column2: KS DRIVERS LICENSE TEST
column6: KS

column2: Question Text
column6: Answer2 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. Before crossing any railroad tracks, you must:
column6: make sure there is room for your vehicle on the other side.
column8: All of the above.

column2: 2. A red arrow on a traffic light means:
column4: You may not turn in the direction of the arrow until a green light or arrow light goes on.
column6: You may turn in in the direction of the arrow after coming to a complete stop.
column8: You must stop and then proceed when the way is clear.

column2: 3. BAC is:
column4: the percentage of alcohol in your blood.
column6: the number of ounces of alcohol in your blood.
column8: the acronym for Beer ACcumulation.

column2: 4. A crosswalk is:
column4: an area designated for blind persons.
column6: a special type of 4-way intersection.
column8: the area where pedestrians may cross the road.

column2: 5. When you pass another vehicle, before you return to the right lane, you must:
column6: look at your interior rear-view mirror.
column8: All of the above.

column2: 6. What is the main reason night driving is more difficult than daytime driving?
column6: Driving within the range.
column8: The use of headlight is required by law.

column2: 7. Any use of a cell phone while operating a motor vehicle is considered a distraction because:
column4: it occupies the driver's mind, hands and eyes.
column6: it draws the attention of other drivers.
column8: it causes the driver to be concerned about the latest news.

column2: 8. Before entering a curve, you should:
column6: pump your brakes several times.
column8: activate your turn signal.

column2: 9. Night driving can be more difficult because:
column4: the speed limit is increased at night.
column6: vehicle speed and distance are harder to judge.
column8: there are more cars on the roads at night.

column2: 10. A pedestrian in the crosswalk when the 'DON’T WALK' signal begins flashing must:
column4: go back and wait the “WALK” light
column6: finish crossing the street.
column8: stop immediately.

column2: 11. On slippery roads, drivers should:
column6: leave more space in front of their vehicle.
column8: increase their speed to avoid hydroplaning.

column2: 12. Aggressive driving includes:
column4: quick lane changes without a signal.
column6: All of the above.
column8: chasing or challenging other drivers.

column2: 13. This sign tells drivers that:
column6: there is a right turn ahead.
column8: they must stay on the right side of the divider

column2: 14. If two vehicles reach the intersection at the same time:
column4: The first vehicle to reach the intersection has the right-of-way.
column6: The vehicle on the right yields to the vehicle on the left.
column8: The vehicle on the left yields to the vehicle on the right.

column2: 15. Just like alcohol and other drugs, drowsiness can:
column6: impair your judgment.
column8: help you to be a better driver.

column2: 16. This road sign means:
column6: Right lane closed
column8: Flagger ahead

column2: 17. __________ are blue with white letters and symbols.
column6: Service signs
column8: Warning signs

column2: 18. At a stop sign there is no stop line, you must stop:
column6: before you enter the intersection.
column8: before you enter the crosswalk.

column2: 19. This sign means:
column4: The lane ahead is reserved for bicycles.
column6: Bicycles should yield to vehicles ahead.
column8: Warning: a bikeway crosses the roadway ahead.

column2: 20. Unlike passenger cars, trucks have blind spots:
column6: on the right.
column8: on the front.

column2: 21. If the entrance lane is too short to allow acceleration to highway speed, you should:
column4: go to the next entrance ramp.
column6: stop and wait for a large gap in traffic, then enter the highway and accelerate quickly.
column8: merge into highway traffic as soon as possible.

column2: 22. In rainy weather, drivers should be most careful when turning or stopping:
column4: during the first half hour of rain.
column6: when it's been raining all day.
column8: after it has been raining for at least two hours.

column2: 23. At a 4-way stop:
column4: the driver to the right has the right-of-way.
column6: the driver reaching the intersection first has the right-of-way.
column8: the driver to the left has the right-of-way.

column2: 24. What do flashing red lights on a school bus indicate?
column4: The bus is about to stop.
column6: The bus is stopped to load or discharge passengers.
column8: Traffic that approaches from either direction may proceed.

column2: 25. If a driver follows you too closely, you should:
column6: move to another lane if possible.
column8: brake suddenly.
